wikipedia_page.main: Sir Cyril Wilson Black (8 April 1902 – 29 October 1991) was a British Conservative politician. He was Member of Parliament (MP) for Wimbledon from 1950 to his retirement at the 1970 general election. He became known for resisting liberalisation of laws on divorce, homosexuality, alcohol licensing and gambling, and his support of the Baptist church and his considerable business empire.
